snippet: SANTORINEOU--Tina, radio announcer, producer, erstwhile "the voice of Greece" in the tri-state area. Born on August 10, 1935 in Athens, Greece; peacefully deceased on April 1, 2016 at New York Presbyterian Hospital. After graduating as a pianist from the National Conservatory in Athens and announcing for Greek National Radio, she immigrated to the United States where she produced and announced at WEVD, then "The station that speaks your language." She is survived by her nephew Victor, her niece Irene, their families, and her monumental contribution to the Greek- American community to whose identity and pride she devoted her entire life. 1/3
lead_paragraph: SANTORINEOU--Tina, radio announcer, producer, erstwhile "the voice of Greece" in the tri-state area. Born on August 10, 1935 in Athens, Greece; peacefully deceased on April 1, 2016 at New York Presbyterian Hospital. After graduating as a pianist from the National Conservatory in Athens and announcing for Greek National Radio, she immigrated to the United States where she produced and announced at WEVD, then "The station that speaks your language." She is survived by her nephew Victor, her niece Irene, their families, and her monumental contribution to the Greek- American community to whose identity and pride she devoted her entire life. 1/3
